Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): As a suitable starting point, document D1, which discloses a method of order management in which a server computer receives location information from GPS terminals, is selected as the closest prior art.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method for brokering offers and demands in the field of transporting freight, comprising the following steps:

(a)
receiving transportation offers/demands from users, including location and time data;

(b)
receiving current location information of the users from GPS terminals with which the users are equipped;

(c)
after receiving a new offer/demand request, verifying if there are previous offers/demands not yet satisfied that can respond to the new request;

(d)
if so, selecting the one for which the current locations of both users are closest; and

(e)
otherwise storing the new request.
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 55 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1 discloses a method for the control of a thermal spray coating process by applying material to a workpiece using a spray jet, detecting deviations in the properties of the particles in said spray jet and adjusting process parameters automatically on the basis of the outcome of a neural network analysis. This document represents the closest prior art.

Step (iii): The difference between the method of claim 1 and D1 concerns the use of a neuro-fuzzy controller combining a neural network and fuzzy logic rules as specified in the second part of step (d).

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A method for coating a workpiece using a thermal spray coating process, the method comprising:

(a)
applying, using a spray jet, a material to the workpiece by thermal spray coating;

(b)
monitoring the thermal spray coating process in real time by detecting properties of particles in the spray jet and supplying the properties as actual values;

(c)
comparing the actual values with target values;

and, in the event that the actual values deviate from the target values,

(d)
adjusting process parameters for the thermal spray coating process automatically by a controller on the basis of a neural network, said controller being a neuro-fuzzy controller which combines a neural-network and fuzzy logic rules and thereby maps statistical relationships between input variables and output variables of the neuro-fuzzy controller
=== END CASE DATA ===

Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): As a suitable starting point, document D1, which discloses a method of order management in which a server computer receives location information from GPS terminals, is selected as the closest prior art.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method for brokering offers and demands in the field of transporting freight, comprising the following steps:

(a)
receiving transportation offers/demands from users, including location and time data;

(b)
receiving current location information of the users from GPS terminals with which the users are equipped;

(c)
after receiving a new offer/demand request, verifying if there are previous offers/demands not yet satisfied that can respond to the new request;

(d)
if so, selecting the one for which the current locations of both users are closest; and

(e)
otherwise storing the new request.
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 33 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.
=== END CASE DATA ===

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Answer questions based ONLY on the text above.
2. Output valid JSON with keys 'reasoning' and 'answer'.

USER:

The patent claim presented for assessment is word\u2011for\u2011word identical to that prior\u2011art claim, containing the same steps (a) through (f). Because there are no distinguishing features, the claimed subject\u2011matter is not novel and, consequently, cannot involve an inventive step. Under the European Patent Convention (EPC) the requirement of inventive step (Article 56 EPC) is not satisfied when the claimed invention is directly disclosed in the prior art. Therefore, a person skilled in the art would find the claimed method obvious in light of the disclosed prior art.", "answer": "The claimed method does not involve an inventive step over the closest prior art; it is identical to the prior\u2011art disclosure and therefore would be considered obvious (and also lacking novelty) under the EPO assessment."}

[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1, which discloses a system for broadcasting video over an xDSL connection to the set-top boxes of subscribers, is selected as the closest prior art. The system comprises a database storing identifiers of subscribers' computers and, in association with them, an indication of the maximum data rate for the data connection to each subscriber's computer. The system further comprises means for transmitting the video to a subscriber's computer at the maximum data rate stored for said computer.

Step (iii): The differences between the subject-matter of claim 1 and D1 are:

(1) 
Storing an indication of an available data rate of the data connection to the remote client, said available data rate being lower than the maximum data rate for the data connection to the remote client. 

(2) 
Using said available data rate to determine the rate at which the data is transmitted to the remote client (instead of transmitting the data at the maximum data rate stored for said remote client as in D1). 

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A system for the transmission of a broadcast media channel to a remote client over a data connection, said system including:

(a)
means for storing an identifier of the remote client and an indication of an available data rate of the data connection to the remote client, said available data rate being lower than the maximum data rate for the data connection to the remote client;

(b)
means for determining a rate at which data is to be transmitted based on the indication of the available data rate of the data connection; and

(c)
means for transmitting data at the determined rate to said remote clien
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 42 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1, which discloses a method for facilitating shopping on a mobile device wherein the user selects a single product and the server determines from a database the vendor selling the selected product nearest to the user and transmits this information to the mobile device, is selected as the closest prior art.

Step (iii): The differences between the subject-matter of claim 1 and D1 are:

(1)
The user can select two or more products to purchase (instead of a single product only). 

(2)
An "optimal shopping tour" for purchasing the two or more products is provided to the user. 

(3)
The optimal shopping tour is determined by the server by accessing a cache memory in which optimal shopping tours determined for previous requests are stored. 

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

Method of facilitating shopping on a mobile device wherein:

(a)
the user selects two or more products to be purchased;

(b)
the mobile device transmits the selected products data and the device location to a server;

(c)
the server accesses a database of vendors to identify vendors offering at least one of the selected products;

(d)
the server determines, on the basis of the device location and the identified vendors, an optimal shopping tour for purchasing the selected products by accessing a cache memory in which optimal shopping tours determined for previous requests are stored; and

(e)
the server transmits the optimal shopping tour to the mobile device for displaying.
=== END CASE DATA ===

[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): As a suitable starting point, document D1, which discloses a method of order management in which a server computer receives location information from GPS terminals, is selected as the closest prior art.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method for brokering offers and demands in the field of transporting freight, comprising the following steps:

(a)
receiving transportation offers/demands from users, including location and time data;

(b)
receiving current location information of the users from GPS terminals with which the users are equipped;

(c)
after receiving a new offer/demand request, verifying if there are previous offers/demands not yet satisfied that can respond to the new request;

(d)
if so, selecting the one for which the current locations of both users are closest; and

(e)
otherwise storing the new request.
=== END CASE DATA ===

[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1, which discloses a system for broadcasting video over an xDSL connection to the set-top boxes of subscribers, is selected as the closest prior art. The system comprises a database storing identifiers of subscribers' computers and, in association with them, an indication of the maximum data rate for the data connection to each subscriber's computer. The system further comprises means for transmitting the video to a subscriber's computer at the maximum data rate stored for said computer.

Step (iii): The differences between the subject-matter of claim 1 and D1 are:

(1) 
Storing an indication of an available data rate of the data connection to the remote client, said available data rate being lower than the maximum data rate for the data connection to the remote client. 

(2) 
Using said available data rate to determine the rate at which the data is transmitted to the remote client (instead of transmitting the data at the maximum data rate stored for said remote client as in D1). 

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A system for the transmission of a broadcast media channel to a remote client over a data connection, said system including:

(a)
means for storing an identifier of the remote client and an indication of an available data rate of the data connection to the remote client, said available data rate being lower than the maximum data rate for the data connection to the remote client;

(b)
means for determining a rate at which data is to be transmitted based on the indication of the available data rate of the data connection; and

(c)
means for transmitting data at the determined rate to said remote clien
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 57 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1 discloses a method for the control of a thermal spray coating process by applying material to a workpiece using a spray jet, detecting deviations in the properties of the particles in said spray jet and adjusting process parameters automatically on the basis of the outcome of a neural network analysis. This document represents the closest prior art.

Step (iii): The difference between the method of claim 1 and D1 concerns the use of a neuro-fuzzy controller combining a neural network and fuzzy logic rules as specified in the second part of step (d).

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A method for coating a workpiece using a thermal spray coating process, the method comprising:

(a)
applying, using a spray jet, a material to the workpiece by thermal spray coating;

(b)
monitoring the thermal spray coating process in real time by detecting properties of particles in the spray jet and supplying the properties as actual values;

(c)
comparing the actual values with target values;

and, in the event that the actual values deviate from the target values,

(d)
adjusting process parameters for the thermal spray coating process automatically by a controller on the basis of a neural network, said controller being a neuro-fuzzy controller which combines a neural-network and fuzzy logic rules and thereby maps statistical relationships between input variables and output variables of the neuro-fuzzy controller
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 35 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 36 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.
=== END CASE DATA ===

[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): As a suitable starting point, document D1, which discloses a method of order management in which a server computer receives location information from GPS terminals, is selected as the closest prior art.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method for brokering offers and demands in the field of transporting freight, comprising the following steps:

(a)
receiving transportation offers/demands from users, including location and time data;

(b)
receiving current location information of the users from GPS terminals with which the users are equipped;

(c)
after receiving a new offer/demand request, verifying if there are previous offers/demands not yet satisfied that can respond to the new request;

(d)
if so, selecting the one for which the current locations of both users are closest; and

(e)
otherwise storing the new request.
=== END CASE DATA ===

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 59 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1 discloses a method for the control of a thermal spray coating process by applying material to a workpiece using a spray jet, detecting deviations in the properties of the particles in said spray jet and adjusting process parameters automatically on the basis of the outcome of a neural network analysis. This document represents the closest prior art.

Step (iii): The difference between the method of claim 1 and D1 concerns the use of a neuro-fuzzy controller combining a neural network and fuzzy logic rules as specified in the second part of step (d).

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A method for coating a workpiece using a thermal spray coating process, the method comprising:

(a)
applying, using a spray jet, a material to the workpiece by thermal spray coating;

(b)
monitoring the thermal spray coating process in real time by detecting properties of particles in the spray jet and supplying the properties as actual values;

(c)
comparing the actual values with target values;

and, in the event that the actual values deviate from the target values,

(d)
adjusting process parameters for the thermal spray coating process automatically by a controller on the basis of a neural network, said controller being a neuro-fuzzy controller which combines a neural-network and fuzzy logic rules and thereby maps statistical relationships between input variables and output variables of the neuro-fuzzy controller
=== END CASE DATA ===

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A method for coating a workpiece using a thermal spray coating process, the method comprising:

(a)
applying, using a spray jet, a material to the workpiece by thermal spray coating;

(b)
monitoring the thermal spray coating process in real time by detecting properties of particles in the spray jet and supplying the properties as actual values;

(c)
comparing the actual values with target values;

and, in the event that the actual values deviate from the target values,

(d)
adjusting process parameters for the thermal spray coating process automatically by a controller on the basis of a neural network, said controller being a neuro-fuzzy controller which combines a neural-network and fuzzy logic rules and thereby maps statistical relationships between input variables and output variables of the neuro-fuzzy controller
=== END CASE DATA ===

CURRENT QUESTION: 
------------------------------------------------------------


[LLM RESPONSE]:
{
  "reasoning": "The closest prior art (D1) discloses a method in which a mobile‑device user selects a single product, the server determines the nearest vendor for that product and sends the vendor information to the device.  Claim 1 differs from D1 in three respects:\n\n1. **Selection of two or more products** – D1 is limited to a single product.  The skilled person would have to consider whether extending the method to multiple products is obvious.  While a user could in principle repeat the single‑product request for each desired item, D1 does not teach or suggest aggregating several selections into a single request or handling them jointly.\n\n2. **Provision of an \"optimal shopping tour\"** – D1 only provides the nearest vendor for a single product; it does not teach the concept of a tour that optimises the order of visiting multiple vendors to purchase several items.  The notion of a shopping tour involves route optimisation (e.g., travelling‑salesman‑type problem) which is not disclosed or hinted at in D1.\n\n3. **Use of a cache memory storing previously determined optimal tours** – D1 contains no teaching about caching or re‑using previously computed tours.  The skilled person would have to combine the idea of a cache (known in other contexts) with the specific problem of optimal shopping tours.  No suggestion or motivation is present in D1 to retrieve pre‑computed tours from a cache to reduce computation.\n\nTo assess inventive step under the problem‑solution approach, the objective technical problem can be formulated as “how to enable a mobile‑device user to obtain a convenient plan for purchasing several selected products from multiple vendors”.  The solution is the combination of the three features above.  None of the features is disclosed in D1, and the combination is not rendered obvious by the teaching of D1.  While route optimisation and caching are known in the art, D1 provides no teaching that would lead the skilled person to apply these known techniques to the specific problem of multi‑product shopping on a mobile device.  Consequently, the skilled person would not arrive at the claimed method in an obvious manner.\n\nTherefore, the subject‑matter of claim 1 involves an inventive step over D1.",
  "answer": "Yes, claim 1 is inventive over the closest prior art D1. The three distinguishing features – (i) selection of two or more products, (ii) provision of an optimal shopping tour, and (iii) use of a cache storing previously determined tours – are not disclosed or suggested by D1, and their combination would not have been obvious to a person skilled in the art. Consequently, the claimed method satisfies the requirement of inventive step under the EPO standards."
}
------------------------------------------------------------

[STDIN to UI.py]: Yes, claim 1 is inventive over the closest prior art D1. The three distinguishing features – (i) selection of two or more products, (ii) provision of an optimal shopping tour, and (iii) use of a cache storing previously determined tours – are not disclosed or suggested by D1, and their combination would not have been obvious to a person skilled in the art. Consequently, the claimed method satisfies the requirement of inventive step under the EPO standards.

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 43 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): Document D1, which discloses a method for facilitating shopping on a mobile device wherein the user selects a single product and the server determines from a database the vendor selling the selected product nearest to the user and transmits this information to the mobile device, is selected as the closest prior art.

Step (iii): The differences between the subject-matter of claim 1 and D1 are:

(1)
The user can select two or more products to purchase (instead of a single product only). 

(2)
An "optimal shopping tour" for purchasing the two or more products is provided to the user. 

(3)
The optimal shopping tour is determined by the server by accessing a cache memory in which optimal shopping tours determined for previous requests are stored. 

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

Method of facilitating shopping on a mobile device wherein:

(a)
the user selects two or more products to be purchased;

(b)
the mobile device transmits the selected products data and the device location to a server;

(c)
the server accesses a database of vendors to identify vendors offering at least one of the selected products;

(d)
the server determines, on the basis of the device location and the identified vendors, an optimal shopping tour for purchasing the selected products by accessing a cache memory in which optimal shopping tours determined for previous requests are stored; and

(e)
the server transmits the optimal shopping tour to the mobile device for displaying.
=== END CASE DATA ===

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Answer questions based ONLY on the text above.
2. Output valid JSON with keys 'reasoning' and 'answer'.

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 56 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Step (ii): As a suitable starting point, document D1, which discloses a method of order management in which a server computer receives location information from GPS terminals, is selected as the closest prior art.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method for brokering offers and demands in the field of transporting freight, comprising the following steps:

(a)
receiving transportation offers/demands from users, including location and time data;

(b)
receiving current location information of the users from GPS terminals with which the users are equipped;

(c)
after receiving a new offer/demand request, verifying if there are previous offers/demands not yet satisfied that can respond to the new request;

(d)
if so, selecting the one for which the current locations of both users are closest; and

(e)
otherwise storing the new request.
=== END CASE DATA ===

The three distinguishing features \u2013 (i) selection of two or more products, (ii) provision of an optimal shopping tour, and (iii) use of a cache storing previously determined tours \u2013 are not disclosed or suggested by D1, and their combination would not have been obvious to a person skilled in the art. Consequently, the claimed method satisfies the requirement of inventive step under the EPO standards."}

[LLM RESPONSE]:
{
  "reasoning": "The patent claim (Claim 1) and the closest prior art claim are textually identical. Both describe the same sequence of steps: (a) controlling an IR camera to capture a temperature image, (b) receiving mean indoor air temperature and humidity over the last 24 h, (c) calculating a condensation temperature from those means, (d) comparing each image point’s temperature to the calculated condensation temperature, (e) identifying points below that temperature as areas at increased risk, and (f) colouring those points to indicate the risk. Because the prior art discloses every feature of the claimed invention, the claimed subject‑matter lacks novelty and, consequently, lacks an inventive step under the EPO approach (Article 56 EPC). No additional technical effect or non‑obvious modification is presented in the patent claim that would distinguish it from the prior art. Therefore, the claim would be considered obvious to a person skilled in the art and does not involve an inventive step.",
  "answer": "The claimed method does not involve an inventive step over the closest prior art; it is obvious and therefore not patentable under the EPO standards."

-------------------- LLM PROMPT (Turn 38 | Mode: TOOL) --------------------
[USER]: You are assessing Inventive Step for the European Patent Office (EPO).
Use the provided CASE DATA strictly. Do not use outside knowledge but you can use your own interpretations of the given facts to reason.
=== CASE DATA ===
--- CLOSEST PRIOR ART ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.

--- PATENT CLAIMS ---
Claim 1:

A computer-implemented method of determining areas in which there is an increased risk of condensation for a surface in a building comprising the steps of:

(a)
controlling an infrared (IR) camera to capture an image of the temperature distribution of the surface;

(b)
receiving mean values for the air temperature and the relative air humidity measured inside the building over the last 24 hours;

(c)
calculating, based on said mean air temperature and mean relative air humidity, a condensation temperature at which there is a risk of condensation on the surface;

(d)
comparing the temperature at each point on the image to said calculated condensation temperature;

(e)
identifying the image points having a temperature lower than the calculated condensation temperature as areas at increased risk of condensation on the surface; and

(f)
modifying the image by colouring the image points identified in step (e) in a particular colour to indicate the areas at increased risk of condensation to a user.
=== END CASE DATA ===
